intro: Terminalia rubrigemmis, commonly known as red sandalwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its dark reddish-brown heartwood, which is highly valued for its durability and aesthetic appeal. The plant belongs to the family Combretaceae and is known for its compound leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats. Terminalia rubrigemmis is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
